00046 #ifdef WIN32
00047 #define FALSE 0
00048 // Win32 does not define F_OK. 08/21/02 jhrg
00049 #define F_OK 0

00051 #define DIR_SEP_CHAR   '\\'

00055 #define DIR_SEP_CHAR   '/'

00069 RCReader* RCReader::_instance = 0;

00071 // This variable (instance_control) is used to ensure that in a MT
00072 // environment _instance is correctly initialized. See the get_instance
00073 // method. 08/07/02 jhrg
00074 #if HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00075 static pthread_once_t instance_control = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT;
00076 #endif

00082 bool
00083 RCReader::write_rc_file(const string &pathname)
00084 {
00085     DBG(cerr << "Writing the RC file to " << pathname << endl);
00086     ofstream fpo(pathname.c_str());
00087 
00088     // If the file couldn't be created.  Nothing needs to be done here,
00089     // the program will simply use the defaults.
00090 
00091     if (fpo) {
00092     // This means we just created the file.  We will now save
00093     // the defaults in it for future use.       
00094     fpo << "# DODS client configuation file. See the DODS" << endl;
00095     fpo << "# users guide for information." << endl;
00096     fpo << "USE_CACHE=" << _dods_use_cache << endl;
00097     fpo << "# Cache and object size are given in megabytes (20 ==> 20Mb)." 
00098         << endl;
00099     fpo << "MAX_CACHE_SIZE=" <<_dods_cache_max  << endl;
00100     fpo << "MAX_CACHED_OBJ=" << _dods_cached_obj << endl;
00101     fpo << "IGNORE_EXPIRES=" << _dods_ign_expires  << endl;
00102     fpo << "CACHE_ROOT=" << d_cache_root << endl;
00103     fpo << "DEFAULT_EXPIRES=" <<_dods_default_expires << endl;
00104     fpo << "ALWAYS_VALIDATE=" << _dods_always_validate << endl;
00105     fpo << "# Request servers compress responses if possible?" << endl;
00106     fpo << "# 1 (yes) or 0 (false)." << endl;
00107     fpo << "DEFLATE=" << _dods_deflate << endl;
00108     fpo << "# Proxy configuration:" << endl;
00109     fpo << "# PROXY_SERVER=<protocol>,<host[:port]>" << endl;
00110     fpo << "# PROXY_SERVER=" <<  _dods_proxy_server_protocol << ","
00111         << _dods_proxy_server_host_url << endl;
00112     fpo << "# PROXY_FOR=<regex>,<host[:port]>" << endl;
00113     fpo << "# PROXY_FOR=" << _dods_proxy_for_regexp << ","
00114         << _dods_proxy_for_proxy_host_url << endl;
00115     fpo << "# NO_PROXY_FOR=<protocol>,<host|domain>" << endl;
00116     fpo << "# NO_PROXY_FOR=" << _dods_no_proxy_for_protocol << ","
00117         << _dods_no_proxy_for_proxy_host << endl;
00118     fpo << "# AIS_DATABASE=<file or url>" << endl;
00119     fpo.close();
00120 
00121     return true;
00122     }
00123     
00124     return false;
00125 }
00126 
00127 bool
00128 RCReader::read_rc_file(const string &pathname)
00129 {
00130     DBG(cerr << "Reading the RC file from " << pathname << endl);
00131 
00132     ifstream fpi(pathname.c_str());
00133     if (fpi) {
00134     // The file exists and we may now begin to parse it.  
00135     // Defaults are already stored in the variables, if the correct
00136     // tokens are found in the file then those defaults will be 
00137     // overwritten. 
00138     char *value;
00139     char *tempstr = new char[256];;
00140     char *tempstr2;
00141     char *tempstr3;
00142     char *tempstr4;
00143 
00144     int tokenlength;
00145     while (true) {
00146         fpi.getline(tempstr, 128);
00147         if (!fpi.good())
00148         break;
00149 
00150         value = strchr(tempstr, '=');
00151         if (!value)
00152         continue;
00153         tokenlength = (int) value - (int) tempstr;
00154         value++;
00155 
00156         if ((strncmp(tempstr, "USE_CACHE", 9) == 0)
00157         && tokenlength == 9) {
00158         _dods_use_cache= atoi(value) ? true : false;
00159         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "MAX_CACHE_SIZE", 14) == 0)
00160                && tokenlength == 14) {
00161         _dods_cache_max = atoi(value);
00162         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "MAX_CACHED_OBJ", 14) == 0)
00163                && tokenlength == 14) {
00164         _dods_cached_obj = atoi(value);
00165         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "IGNORE_EXPIRES", 14) == 0)
00166                && tokenlength == 14) {
00167         _dods_ign_expires= atoi(value);
00168         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "DEFLATE", 7) == 0)
00169                && tokenlength == 7) {
00170         _dods_deflate= atoi(value) ? true : false;
00171         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "CACHE_ROOT", 10) == 0)
00172                && tokenlength == 10) {
00173         d_cache_root = value;
00174         if (d_cache_root[d_cache_root.length() - 1] != DIR_SEP_CHAR) 
00175             d_cache_root += string(DIR_SEP_STRING);
00176         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "DEFAULT_EXPIRES", 15) == 0)
00177                && tokenlength == 15) {
00178         _dods_default_expires= atoi(value);
00179         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "ALWAYS_VALIDATE", 15) == 0)
00180                && tokenlength == 15) {
00181         _dods_always_validate = atoi(value);
00182         } else if (strncmp(tempstr, "AIS_DATABASE", 12) == 0 
00183              && tokenlength == 12) {
00184         d_ais_database = value;
00185         }
00186         // Check for tags relating to the proxy server
00187         // 8.20.2000 cjm
00188         else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "PROXY_SERVER", 12) == 0)
00189              && tokenlength == 12) {
00190         // Setup a proxy server for all requests.
00191         tempstr2 = value;
00192         if (tempstr2 != NULL) {
00193             tempstr3 = strchr(tempstr2, ',');
00194             if (tempstr3 != NULL) {
00195             tempstr3[0] = (char) 0; //terminate access
00196             // method string.
00197             tempstr3++; //advance pointer.
00198             // Setup the proxy server.  tempstr2 is
00199             // the access method (ftp, http, etc)
00200             // and tempstr3 is a fully qualified 
00201             // name which includes the access method.
00202             _dods_proxy_server_protocol=string(tempstr2);
00203             _dods_proxy_server_host_url=string(tempstr3);
00204             }
00205       
00206         }
00207         } 
00208         else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "PROXY_FOR", 9) == 0)
00209              && tokenlength == 9) {
00210         // Setup a proxy server for any requests
00211         // matching the given regular expression.
00212         tempstr2 = value;
00213         if (tempstr2 != NULL) {
00214             tempstr3 = strchr(tempstr2, ',');
00215             if (tempstr3 != NULL) {
00216             tempstr3[0] = (char) 0; //terminate
00217             //tempstr2
00218             tempstr3++; // point to proxy server;
00219             tempstr4 = strchr(tempstr3, ',');
00220             // tempstr4 will be !NULL only if the regex flags
00221             // are given. But we're not going to support
00222             // those unless requested. So handle the case
00223             // where they are not given, too. 10/25/2000 jhrg
00224             if (tempstr4 != NULL) {
00225                 tempstr4[0] = (char) 0; //terminate
00226                 //tempstr3
00227                 tempstr4++;
00228                 _dods_proxy_for_regexp_flags = atoi(tempstr4);
00229           
00230             }
00231             _dods_proxy_for_regexp=string(tempstr2);
00232             _dods_proxy_for_proxy_host_url=string(tempstr3);
00233             _dods_proxy_for = true;
00234             }
00235         }
00236         } else if ((strncmp(tempstr, "NO_PROXY_FOR", 12) == 0)
00237                && tokenlength == 12) {
00238         // Dont use a proxy server for the host
00239         // specified.  Multiple NO_PROXY_FOR entries
00240         // can be in the .dodsrc.  cjm
00241         tempstr2 = value;
00242         if (tempstr2 != NULL) {
00243             tempstr3 = strchr(tempstr2, ',');
00244             if (tempstr3 != NULL) {
00245             tempstr3[0] = (char) 0; //terminate
00246             //tempstr2
00247             tempstr3++; // point to access method.
00248             tempstr4 = strchr(tempstr3, ',');
00249             if (tempstr4 != NULL) {
00250                 tempstr4[0] = (char) 0; //terminate
00251                 //tempstr3
00252                 tempstr4++;
00253                 _dods_no_proxy_for_port = atoi(tempstr4);
00254             }
00255         
00256             // add proxy server for host 
00257             // 'tempstr2' w/ access method 
00258             // 'tempstr3' and port 'noproxy_host_port'.
00259             // NB: Params reversed from above. 10/23/2000 jhrg
00260             _dods_no_proxy_for_protocol=string(tempstr2);
00261             _dods_no_proxy_for_proxy_host=string(tempstr3);
00262             _dods_no_proxy_for = true;
00263             }
00264         }
00265         }
00266     }
00267     
00268     delete [] tempstr;
00269     tempstr = 0;
00270     
00271     fpi.close();    // Close the .dodsrc file. 12/14/99 jhrg
00272     
00273     return true;
00274     }  // End of cache file parsing.
00275 
00276     return false;
00277 }
00278 
00279 // This function deletes the object which calls the destructor. In this case
00280 // it doesn't do anything, but ... 10/08/02 jhrg
00281 void  
00282 rcreader_clean()
00283 {
00284     if (RCReader::_instance) {
00285     delete RCReader::_instance;
00286     RCReader::_instance = 0;
00287     }
00288 }
00289 
00290 // Helper for check_env_var(). This is its main logic, separated out for the
00291 // cases under WIN32 where we don't use an environment variable.  09/19/03
00292 // jhrg 
00293 string
00294 RCReader::check_string(string env_var)
00295 {
00296     struct stat stat_info;
00297 
00298     if (stat(env_var.c_str(), &stat_info) != 0)
00299     return "";      // ENV VAR not a file or dir, bail
00300 
00301     if (S_ISREG(stat_info.st_mode))
00302     return env_var;     // ENV VAR is a file, use it
00303 
00304     // ENV VAR is a directory, does it contain .dodsrc? Can we create
00305     // .dodsrc if it's not there?
00306     if (S_ISDIR(stat_info.st_mode)) {
00307     if (*env_var.rbegin() != DIR_SEP_CHAR)  // Add trailing / if missing
00308         env_var += DIR_SEP_STRING;
00309     // Trick: set d_cache_root here in case we're going to create the
00310     // .dodsrc later on. If the .dodsrc file exists, its value will
00311     // overwrite this value, if not write_rc_file() will use the correct
00312     // value. 09/19/03 jhrg
00313     d_cache_root = env_var + string(".dods_cache") + DIR_SEP_STRING;
00314     env_var += ".dodsrc";
00315     if (stat(env_var.c_str(), &stat_info) == 0 &&
00316         S_ISREG(stat_info.st_mode))
00317         return env_var; // Found .dodsrc in ENV VAR
00318 
00319     // Didn't find .dodsrc in ENV VAR and ENV VAR is a directory; try to
00320     // create it. Note write_rc_file uses d_cache_root (set above) when
00321     // it creates the RC file's contents.
00322     if (write_rc_file(env_var))
00323         return env_var;
00324     }
00325 
00326     // If we're here, then we've not found or created the RC file.
00327     return "";
00328 }
00329 
00339 string 
00340 RCReader::check_env_var(const string &variable_name) 
00341 { 
00342     char *ev = getenv(variable_name.c_str());
00343     if (!ev || strlen(ev) == 0)
00344     return "";
00345     
00346     return check_string(ev);
00347 }
00348 
00349 RCReader::RCReader()
00350 {
00351     atexit(rcreader_clean);
00352   
00353     d_rc_file_path = "";
00354     d_cache_root = "";
00355 
00356     // ** Set default values **
00357     // Users must explicitly turn caching on.
00358     _dods_use_cache=false;
00359     _dods_cache_max=20;
00360     _dods_cached_obj=5;
00361     _dods_ign_expires=0;
00362     _dods_default_expires= 86400;
00363     _dods_always_validate=0;
00364 
00365     _dods_deflate=0;
00366 
00367     //flags for PROXY_SERVER=<protocol>,<host url>
00368     _dods_proxy_server_protocol = "";
00369     _dods_proxy_server_host_url = "";
00370 
00371     // flags for PROXY_FOR=<regex>,<proxy host url>,<flags>
00372     _dods_proxy_for = false;    // true if proxy_for is used.
00373     _dods_proxy_for_regexp = "";
00374     _dods_proxy_for_proxy_host_url = "";
00375     _dods_proxy_for_regexp_flags = 0;
00376 
00377     //flags for NO_PROXY_FOR=<protocol>,<host>,<port>
00378     _dods_no_proxy_for = false;
00379     _dods_no_proxy_for_protocol = "";
00380     _dods_no_proxy_for_proxy_host = "";
00381     // default to port 0 if not specified. This means all ports. Using 80
00382     // will fail when the URL does not contain the port number. That's
00383     // probably a bug in libwww. 10/23/2000 jhrg
00384     _dods_no_proxy_for_port=0;
00385 
00386 #ifdef WIN32
00387     string homedir = string("C:") + string(DIR_SEP_STRING) + string("Dods");
00388     d_rc_file_path = check_string(homedir);
00389     //  Normally, I'd prefer this for WinNT-based systems.
00390     if (d_rc_file_path.empty())
00391     d_rc_file_path = check_env_var("APPDATA");
00392     if (d_rc_file_path.empty())
00393     d_rc_file_path = check_env_var("TEMP");
00394     if (d_rc_file_path.empty())
00395     d_rc_file_path = check_env_var("TMP");
00396 #else
00397     d_rc_file_path = check_env_var("DODS_CONF");
00398     if (d_rc_file_path.empty())
00399     d_rc_file_path = check_env_var("HOME");
00400 #endif
00401 
00402     if (!d_rc_file_path.empty())
00403     read_rc_file(d_rc_file_path);
00404 
00405     if (_dods_use_cache) {
00406     string lockstr = d_cache_root + string(".lock");
00407     remove(lockstr.c_str());
00408     }
00409 }
00410 
00411 RCReader::~RCReader()
00412 {
00413 #if 0
00414     // Don't always write the cache file. This was erasing values that
00415     // were set (and besides, it's confusing to see that the file's creation
00416     // date is always changing. Since this shouldn't be adding anything new,
00417     // DON'T write it out here. 6/27/2002 jhrg
00418     if(_instance)
00419     _instance->write_rc_file();
00420 #endif
00421 }
00422 
00423 void
00424 initialize_instance()
00425 {
00426     // MT-Safe if called via pthread_once or similar
00427     RCReader::_instance = new RCReader;
00428 }
00429 
00430 RCReader* 
00431 RCReader::instance()
00432 {
00433 #if HAVE_PTHREAD_H
00434     // The instance_control variable is defined at the top of this file.
00435     // 08/07/02 jhrg
00436     pthread_once(&instance_control, initialize_instance);
00437 #else
00438     if (!_instance)
00439     initialize_instance();
00440 #endif
00441 
00442     return _instance;
00443 }
